title: BARD IS LIFE
body:
Hello Everyone.
I thought id take a bit of time and talk about  {{champion:432}}  and see what what everyone else thinks of him currently.
I feel People vastly underestimate Bard's versatility, and i was hoping to get some insight on what everyone else think's.
So id like to discuss the following:

What role does he/you play in a team composition when playing Bard?

What are the core items you built on him?

What are your  rune/mastery setups?

What champions do you think synergize well with bard?

What is the counterplay against him?

Out of all the supports where do you see him placed in rank/efficiency 

Now I know you can google all of this and it can be very extensive and situational , but non the less id love to heard what you all think on him as a champion and his roles in a team.

So feel free to chime in with your thoughts.

Cheers Shdw {{champion:432}}

replies.body:
He acts as a disengager, an initiator, a disruptor, a diver, a healer, a strong roamer, a tank, burst mage and provides some mobility to his team in the jungle. 

I play him as support and he does take some practice to use properly as opposed to other supports who are relatively easy to pick up.

His Q is very basic yet also very potent, it's ability to stun if it connects with a wall or a minion means it can be very unpredictable as to how you use it. It's base damage is really high at level 1, he has half an ADC's health bar with AA>Q>AA thunderlords proc alone.

His R is arguably the most versatile spell in his kit in the game in that it can disrupt an entire backline, catch out stray targets from a mile away, it can be used to cancel channel abilities like miss fortunes ultimate, lock out priority targets from a fight and disengage from unwanted battles.

Personally I build {{item:3092}}  {{item:3190}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3117}} {{item:2045}}  as core due to playing him in the support role.

His greatest weakness is ranged CC or lane bullies that will be able to punish his short range with a lot of damage if he messes up and that while he can use his magical journey to pass through walls, he is not the fastest champion nor is he truly uncatchable.

I know very little about the support role and haven't played much with a Bard so here goes nothing:

A pick support, what with his slow/stun and ulti. Also a fair bit of roaming going on.

Absolutely no idea with items (without googling). Movespeed/health/standard support items?

I feel like Cait would be nice with him, and maybe Ez for a heavy poke lane.

Counterplay might be hard cc/bursting him down. Also not getting baited into his magical journeys of death where his team is on the other side.

Rank and efficiency really depends, as his ulti is a unique skill and how he uses it absolutely determines how effective he is. When you consider its potential to turn baron/dragon plays, allow turret dives etc then he can have a huge impact. If he's just using it as a zhonya to save teammates then maybe not so much.

What are your thoughts on him?
